items.title: 'Aston Villa denkt aan oud-verdediger AZ'
items.summary: In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Ongenaakbaar Bar√ßa op titelkoers: 'Zelfs een light-versie is veel verder dan Real'
items.summary: FC Barcelona gaat als winterkampioen van La Liga het jaar uit. Het verschil tussen de ploeg van Hansi Flick en naarste achtervolger Real Madrid is immens, stellen diverse Spaanse media. Vooral als er wordt ingezoomd op het aantal doelpunten dat Barcelona doorgaans maakt. 2025 was een jaar dat deed denken aan het Lionel Messi-tijdperk. 'Een vernedering voor Real Madrid.'

items.title: Had ook dit fraaie doelpunt van Heerenveen moeten worden afgekeurd?
items.summary: SC Heerenveen zag zaterdag tegen Heracles Almelo in de eerste helft twee goals worden afgekeurd wegens buitenspel en eigenlijk had ook de 0-1 van Jacob Trenskow niet mogen tellen. Uit beelden van de assistent-trainer van Heracles bleek dat Dylan Vente in aanloop naar die treffer buitenspel stond.

items.title: Veldman daagt Trenskow uit bij Heerenveen: 'Dat is de hogere norm die we zetten'
items.summary: Jacob Trenskow ging dankzij drie doelpunten en een assist in de laatste drie wedstrijden als de MVP van SC Heerenveen de winterstop in. Robin Veldman verwacht voor de tweede seizoenshelft n√≥g meer van de technische aanvaller.

items.title: Ref Watch LIVE! Controversial Everton and Newcastle penalty decisions analysed
Linssen krijgt geel voor tackle van achteren: was rood op zijn plaats?
items.summary: Bryan Linssen kreeg zaterdag een gele kaart voor een tackle van achteren op Ajax-verdediger Ko Itakura. Er was discussie of de overtreding van de 35-jarige aanvaller niet zwaarder had moeten worden bestraft.

items.title: Tomori on Tuchel, living in Italy and why this is the best he has felt
items.summary: Fikayo Tomori says his success at AC Milan shows English players "can go abroad and adapt to a different way of living".

items.title: Premier League: 10 talking points from the weekend‚Äôs action
items.summary: Highs and lows for Alexander Isak, Wolves‚Äô sobering survival chances and were Chelsea lucky at Newcastle? Premier League scoring charts Can results be misleading? That is the question. Aston Villa‚Äôs winning streak continued against Manchester United, but so did the nagging doubts. They were the lesser team by several measures ‚Äì fewer shots (12-15), less possession (43-57), fewer big chances (2-3). As usual, the victory was a slender one. As usual, our friend xG was unimpressed: according to Opta, United edged it 1.31-1.02. But, as every fan knows, games are not won by xG. They are won by solid teamwork, shrewd management and individual talent ‚Äì and Villa have all three. Morgan Rogers may be their only star, but he‚Äôs delivering like Father Christmas. Unai Emery is wily, battle-hardened, five years ahead of Ruben Amorim. If Rogers profited from Leny Yoro‚Äôs naivety, that was probably because Emery had spotted that Yoro is not a right-back, and told Rogers to start wide, cut in and torment him. Talent and management, working together. items.title: From Rochdale to Rabat: the Lancashire duo at the forefront of Tanzania‚Äôs Afcon bid
items.summary: Friends Tarryn Allarakhia and Haji Mnoga will step out together in Morocco having shared a path in the English lower leagues Like all good things, Tarryn Allarakhia and Haji Mnoga‚Äôs friendship began at a National League match between Wealdstone and Aldershot in 2023 when they were opponents. Since then they have moved to the north-west and are heading into a second Africa Cup of Nations as Tanzania internationals together. This is the fourth time Tanzania, who sit 112th in Fifa‚Äôs rankings, have qualified for the tournament but they are yet to secure a victory. In C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire in 2023, Allarakhia and Mnoga were part of a squad that secured draws against Zambia and DR Congo, but that was not enough to get them out of the group. Nigeria, the highest-ranked side in the group, will be their first opponents on Tuesday before clashes with Tunisia and Uganda in Morocco for the Taifa Stars. Continue reading...

items.title: January transfer window: Key dates and Deadline Day
items.summary: The transfer window re-opens on Thursday January 1, allowing clubs across the leagues to seek reinforcements and reshape their squads.

items.title: Today on Sky Sports Racing: American Flight set to take off at Wolverhampton
items.summary: We have a busy day's racing on Monday with Flat action from Lingfield, Wolverhampton and Deauville live on Sky Sports Racing...

items.title: New Zealand secure West Indies Test series win after five Duffy wickets
items.summary: Jacob Duffy took 5-42 as New Zealand bowled out the West Indies for 138 on a deteriorating fifth-day pitch to win the third Test by 323 runs and take the three-match series 2-0.

items.title: Patriots secure playoff return in comeback win over Ravens
items.summary: Drake Maye guided New England to a pair of fourth-quarter touchdowns, rallying his team from an 11-point deficit to a 28-24 victory over Baltimore on Sunday night that clinched a post-season spot for the Patriots and dealt a devastating blow to the Ravens' playoff hopes.

items.title: 'Incredible' Rice is 'future captain of England' - Rooney
items.summary: Former England forward Wayne Rooney hails Arsenal midfielder Declan Rice as a "future captain of England".

items.title: Kane smashes Arjen Robben record in Bayern rout
items.summary: Harry Kane scored his 30th club goal of the season as Bayern Munich shrugged off an injury and illness crisis to sweep past Heidenheim 4-0 on Sunday and go into the Bundesliga's winter break with a nine-point lead.

items.title: United's Fernandes out a 'while' with injury blow
items.summary: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes was substituted at halftime of the team's Premier League clash against Aston Villa with an apparent hamstring issue.

items.title: Man United's Mazaroui 'fantastic' in Hakimi role
items.summary: Achraf Hakimi was unable to make his comeback from injury in Morocco's opener at the Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday -- a 2-0 victory over Comoros -- but head coach Walid Regragui said his replacement is just as strong an option.

items.title: Liverpool fear Alexander Isak has fractured leg after horror injury against Spurs
items.summary: Striker hurt by Van de Ven tackle when opening scoring MRI scan results to reveal length of spell on sidelines Liverpool fear their record signing, Alexander Isak, has fractured his left leg and will face months on the sidelines. The league champions are waiting on the results of an MRI scan after the ¬£125m man was injured against Tottenham in Saturday‚Äôs Premier League game. The 26-year-old sustained the problem while scoring the opener against Spurs ‚Äì his second league goal of an already injury-hit debut season ‚Äì in the 2-1 win after the defender Micky van de Ven slid across and caught his leg as the striker planted it on the ground. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Fighter' Rogers shows importance as Villa stay in title race
items.summary: Morgan Rogers shows his importance to Aston Villa with two goals in a win over Manchester United, as Unai Emery's side remain in the title hunt.

items.title: El Kaabi‚Äôs stunning strike caps Morocco‚Äôs win over Comoros in Afcon opener
items.summary: The Africa Cup of Nations hosts, Morocco, overcame a nervy start to beat Comoros in the tournament‚Äôs opening game on Sunday after Brahim D√≠az and the substitute Ayoub El Kaabi scored second-half goals. It was a far from convincing showing, however, from highly fancied Morocco who are 97 places above the small Indian Ocean island nation in the world rankings and had to toil hard for the points in the rain at Rabat‚Äôs Prince Moulay Abdellah stadium. Continue reading...
